result.ponchtml: ṫréig sí a tír ḋúċais ar son poist mar ḟeiġlí linḃ le teaġlaċ in ÉirinnShe abandoned her native country for a job as a child minder with a family in Ireland.

result.eng: They moved to France because they were very well aware how dangerous things were for Polish Jews.
result.ga: bhog siad go dtí an fhrainc mar is maith a d'airigh siad an chontúirt a bhí ann do ghiúdaigh na polainne
result.orig: Bhog siad go dtí an Fhrainc mar is maith a d'airigh siad an chontúirt a bhí ann do Ghiúdaigh na Polainne
result.html: bhog siad go dtí an fhrainc mar is maith a d'airigh siad an chontúirt a bhí ann do ghiúdaigh na polainneThey moved to France because they were very well aware how dangerous things were for Polish Jews.
result.ponchtml: ḃog siad go dtí an ḟrainc mar is maiṫ a d'airiġ siad an ċontúirt a ḃí ann do ġiúdaiġ na polainneThey moved to France because they were very well aware how dangerous things were for Polish Jews.

result.eng: As we know now, the Nazis didn't stop with Poland.
result.ga: mar is eol dúinn anois níor stop na naitsithe leis an bpolainn
result.orig: Mar is eol dúinn anois níor stop na Naitsithe leis an bPolainn
result.html: mar is eol dúinn anois níor stop na naitsithe leis an bpolainnAs we know now, the Nazis didn't stop with Poland.
result.ponchtml: mar is eol dúinn anois níor stop na naitsiṫe leis an bpolainnAs we know now, the Nazis didn't stop with Poland.

result.eng: The Nazis perpetrated a terrible slaughter on the townsmen as revenge for the actions of the French Resistance.
result.ga: rinne na naitsithe ár uafásach ar fhir an bhaile mar dhíoltas ar ghníomhartha fhrithbheartaíocht na fraince
result.orig: Rinne na Naitsithe ár uafásach ar fhir an bhaile mar dhíoltas ar ghníomhartha Fhrithbheartaíocht na Fraince
result.html: rinne na naitsithe ár uafásach ar fhir an bhaile mar dhíoltas ar ghníomhartha fhrithbheartaíocht na frainceThe Nazis perpetrated a terrible slaughter on the townsmen as revenge for the actions of the French Resistance.
result.ponchtml: rinne na naitsiṫe ár uafásaċ ar ḟir an ḃaile mar ḋíoltas ar ġníoṁarṫa ḟriṫḃeartaíoċt na frainceThe Nazis perpetrated a terrible slaughter on the townsmen as revenge for the actions of the French Resistance.

result.eng: It is a pity that our generation never had a "JFK moment" like the one that came before us.
result.ga: is trua nach raibh jfk moment ag ár nglúin féin mar a bhí ag an gceann a tháinig romhainn
result.orig: Is trua nach raibh JFK moment ag ár nglúin féin mar a bhí ag an gceann a tháinig romhainn
result.html: is trua nach raibh jfk moment ag ár nglúin féin mar a bhí ag an gceann a tháinig romhainnIt is a pity that our generation never had a "JFK moment" like the one that came before us.
result.ponchtml: is trua naċ raiḃ jfk moment ag ár nglúin féin mar a ḃí ag an gceann a ṫáinig roṁainnIt is a pity that our generation never had a "JFK moment" like the one that came before us.

result.eng: I turned on the radio, as usual, to listen to the morning's news programme.

result.orig: Chuireas an raidió ar siúl mar ab iondúil chun nuachtchlár na maidine a chloisteáil

result.eng: People started being evacuated from tall buildings around the country such as Sears Tower in Chicago.

result.orig: Tosaíodh ag aslonnú daoine as foirgnimh mhóra timpeall na tíre mar Túr Sears in Siceágo

result.eng: I had to undergo a close examination of my retina and my fingerprints, like every non-American citizen on his way into the country.
result.ga: rinneadh scrúdú iomlán ar mo reitine agus ar mo mhéarlorga mar a dhéantar le gach éinne nach saoránach meiriceánach é ar a bhealach isteach sa tír

result.eng: Because of these developments, the citizen now had a toolbox that gave him the chance to function as a journalist, globally and at little cost.

result.eng: Also, what bloggers often got in response to their opinions was abuse from anonymous people.

result.eng: So, they started buying workers from Africa.

result.eng: It wasn't long before white people started looking at black people as a sub-race.

result.eng: As the country spread out west, more states joined the union that did not accept slavery.

result.eng: You could have gotten rid of him a little more kindly than you did.

result.eng: Maybe things wouldn't be like this [the family being evicted] if had been more economical/thrifty.

result.eng: I hardly imagined I'd leave the way I did.
